content:
Here's an example of how you can set up a basic income and expense tracking spreadsheet:

**Income**

| **Date** | **Income Source** | **Amount** |
| --- | --- | --- |
| 01/01/2023 | Salary | $2,500 |
| 01/15/2023 | Disability Benefits | $1,000 |
| 01/20/2023 | Part-time Job | $800 |

**Fixed Expenses**

| **Category** | **Monthly Amount** | **Due Date** |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Rent | $1,200 | 1st of the month |
| Utilities (Electricity, Water, Gas) | $150 | 15th of the month |
| Internet and Phone | $100 | 20th of the month |
| Insurance (Health, Auto, etc.) | $200 | 25th of the month |

**Variable Expenses**

| **Category** | **Monthly Budget** | **Actual Spend** |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Food | $500 |  |
| Transportation (Gas, Maintenance, etc.) | $200 |  |
| Entertainment (Dining out, Movies, etc.) | $200 |  |
| Hobbies | $100 |  |
| Miscellaneous (Pet expenses, Subscriptions, etc.) | $100 |  |

**Debt Repayment**

| **Debt** | **Monthly Payment** | **Due Date** |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Credit Card | $200 | 10th of the month |
| Student Loan | $300 | 15th of the month |
| Personal Loan | $150 | 20th of the month |

** Totals**

| **Income** | **Fixed Expenses** | **Variable Expenses** | **Debt Repayment** | **Total** |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| $4,300 | $1,650 |  | $650 | $3,300 |

In this example, you have separate sections for:

1. **Income**: Track all your income sources, including salary, benefits, and any side hustles.
2. **Fixed Expenses**: List your regular, non-discretionary expenses, such as rent, utilities, and insurance. These expenses usually have a fixed amount and due date.
3. **Variable Expenses**: Track your discretionary expenses, such as food, entertainment, and hobbies. You can set a budget for each category and track your actual spend.
4. **Debt Repayment**: List your debts, including credit cards, loans, and their corresponding monthly payments and due dates.
5. **Totals**: Calculate your total income, fixed expenses, variable expenses, debt repayment, and total spending to get a clear picture of your financial situation.

Remember to customize the categories and columns based on your personal financial situation and needs. As you track your income and expenses, you'll be able to identify areas for improvement and make adjustments to your budget accordingly.
